date_h.intro_Txt: Define the time and date settings for your Axis product, manually or automatically, as described below.
date_h.current_Txt: Shows the current date and time.
date_h.zone_Txt: Time Zone - Select the time zone where your product is located.
date_h.daylight_Txt: Automatically adjust for daylight saving changes - Check this box to automatically update the time changes caused by daylight saving.
date_h.mode_Txt1: Time Mode - Select the method to use for setting the time:
date_h.mode_Txt2: Synchronize with computer time - Sets the time according to the clock on your computer
date_h.nTP_Txt: Synchronize with NTP Server - Obtains the correct time from an NTP server every few minutes. The NTP server's IP address or host name is specified in the Advanced TCP/IP Settings
date_h.nTPSWclock_Txt: . This option should be checked if using IEEE 802.1X
date_h.setMan_Txt: Set manually - Using this option allows you to manually enter the time and date
date_h.nTPSWclNote_Txt: Note: It is strongly recommended to use an NTP server for time synchronization. The clock in the product stops when there is no power and the NTP server will synchronize the time automatically when power is restored.
date_h.subTitle_image_Txt: Date & Time Format Used in Images
date_h.format_Txt1: The format selected here will be used when displaying the date and time as an overlay in the video image.
date_h.format_Txt2: The abbreviations used in the predefined date formats are as follows:
date_h.format_Txt4: MM or Mmm = month, e.g. 12 or Dec
date_h.format_Txt5: DD or D = day, e.g. 02 or 2
date_h.format_Txt7: The predefined time formats available are 12h and 24h, and at the resolution 1 second or 1/100 seconds.
date_h.own_Txt: It is also possible to use your own custom date and time formats in images. Check the box(es) for Own and enter the date and time formats required. The valid options can be found on the help page for File Naming & Date/Time Formats.
